It was Reav3's idea. {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-rainbows}} I worked on it a bit with LtRandolph. 

It's not mentioned in the patch notes, but not every character/faction-specific taunt was moved over. Some didn't make sense (in our opinion), or 2 out of the 3 options didn't make sense... And there were tech limitations as well. For example, we couldn't combine Tahm Kench's ally and enemy taunts without requiring everyone to download a bunch of sound files again, bloating the patch size (a big issue in some regions). So only the enemy taunts became first encounters.

Basically, you're right. Two person indie project. Looking to make the most value with the least negative impact!!

Seriously tho I think this was a great idea but what about champs that don't have specific taunts but that don't need any in-game update (as I stated before, champs like Syndra and/or Zyra), would you ever consider adding some? This might be out of your domain, and if so I'm sorry to bother you with tha, but I was wondering ^^!

We've done a bit of this in the past! I wrote new new lines for Lux, and Maokai too when he was updated in the Tanks class update.  

I think it's actually more difficult for a company Riot's size (vs. an indie company) to make these sorts of changes, since there's cost involved (casting and recording VO across a dozen-ish languages), and anything that requires investment has to be weighed against all the other things going on that require investment. 

VO is also a really important part of a character, and making changes to characters always carries its own risks. I know we felt better about shipping the Maokai updates than Lux (who was a huge risk, IMHO, we'd never done something like that before), since his new lore had already shipped and he was getting new gameplay, so it was kind of like a mini-VGU. But even that update was controversial due to different ideas of who Maokai should be, what he should sound like, etc. [Meddler also wrote a post](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/irL2yrul-quick-gameplay-thoughts-october-12) about how this sort of thing led to Miss Fortune's VO update being canceled, if you don't mind extra reading.

We haven't given up, we'll keep looking for opportunities. Just want to provide context why some of these characters remain out of date. We want to do it right, when it makes sense.

Have you considered directly polling the players here on the forums, in client, and on reddit to get a feel for what we like in the characters when deciding on updating their VO? I personally believe that an updated, fully fleshed out VO is much better than an outdated, limited VO that's lingering in the past - and so long as someone like Miss Fortune doesn't become a chipper child like Zoe in pirate hooker boots, and keeps to her theme of a badass pirate, I don't understand why and how a new VO can be that controversial. And sometimes, for the sake of progress, you've got to cut off the baggage holding you down and move on, or else things will stagnate and never move forward. 

Even if you can't completely agree on how to do someone like Miss Fortune, you guys own her and her story, and YOU know how she's supposed to be in the lore, so at some point you've all got to man up and press forward with _something_ to improve her. I don't see why a limited VO with a few cheeky lines and outdated material can seriously define a character so rigidly that you find it impossible to reinvent their vocals to fit her current lore and the standards of the game. You talk constantly of risks, but it doesn't seem like you take any. After all, Riot _did_ ignore the opportunity to fully VGU Miss Fortune back during the Gangplank VGU event, so either improve her in parts or give her a full, real VGU. It's frustrating to hear you waffle over "but it's risky to update a voice" when so many other champions get fully remade voices in their VGUs like Irelia, Akali, and Swain, while champions like Sona and Miss Fortune still call you summoner.

Were you around when they asked the community about Nautilus before the Bilgewater update with Pyke's release?  I feel that's exactly the kind of thing you're looking for and I wish they'd do stuff like that more often.

Meddler's article covers how we did this for the Miss Fortune VO as well. It's because of player feedback that we took a step back. 

But sometimes what some players want isn't what the character, game, IP, even _other players_ need. So we do make changes to characters, we don't just throw our hands up and walk away.

My apologies if, in showing nuance, it felt like waffling. I personally believe we do what you recommend, and I agree with you in recommending it.
I have a lot if respect for how things have been handled in the past; I didn't mean to imply anything.  Although since you mention MF, you may have meant to reply to Oleandervine?

So i was always wondering. Why are you guys not throwing a couple of new lines to base champion when you are making a legendary skin ?

In the case of Lux/MF, those were both done in coordination with their Ultimate skins, so I agree that this is totally a thing they could do if writers have ideas as they're writing for the Legendary skin.

But I also want to point out some potential problems that might prevent it from happening, if you don't mind.

Of course, writers for skins VO are not the same people as writers for Champion VO, so that could potentially lead to problems in lines that those skins writers come up with not "fitting in" properly.
Some Legendary skins have a separate actress/actor from the base champ (Veigar, Heimerdinger I believe), so it's not as simple as adding a couple lines here and there.
And some champs don't need added lines of course (Kayn and Rhaast come to mind as not needing anything added, since they're already very modern).

However, in the case of champions who don't have modern VO (which is primarily who these "a couple of new lines" would be aimed at), I'm sure players would greatly prefer a full VO update instead of "just" a few lines added.  I can see people feeling cheated that they didn't just give them a full VO in those cases.  And if you HAVE the actor around and the champ needs VO update, doesn't it just make sense to do that?  Again, that was the case with Lux and MF (I'd assume a few other champs too, although pure VO updates are relatively rare).

Older champions have special interactions for other champions that you would hear when you taunted(or ctrl 2) that champion on the enemy team. Now, instead of having to press ctrl 2 to hear those lines, they will now play automatically when that champion sees the champion they have an interaction for the first time.

Example:
{{champion:202}} taunting enemy Ionian: "You only understand harmony. Discord is required for contrast."
{{champion:202}} taunting enemy {{champion:238}}: "You belong in the shadows. No audience could love you."

to

{{champion:202}} first encounter enemy Ionian: "You only understand harmony. Discord is required for contrast."
{{champion:202}} first encounter enemy {{champion:238}}: "You belong in the shadows. No audience could love you."


Ect, ect.
Special champion interactions that you used to have to /taunt to hear, now play when the champs first encounter each other in game.
